intro: Descurainia pinnata subsp. halictorum, commonly known as the prairie hawksbeard, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies, roadsides, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a single, elongated inflorescence, and the leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance. It is often found in the central and eastern United States, where it plays a role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
